channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Starship Explosions Show SpaceX No Longer Defying Gravity
item.description: Consecutive losses of the Starship rocket suggest that the company’s engineers are not as infallible as its fans may think.

item.title: The pastor leading the Target DEI boycott says the company is turning its back on Black consumers—and there are more protests to come
item.description: Over 130,000 people have signed up to participate so far.

item.title: Christians Are Pressing Trump to Clear a Path for Israel to Annex the West Bank
item.description: Some 80 percent of white, evangelical Christians voted for President Trump. Now, some want a policy change that could undermine a future Palestinian s...

item.title: What’s your VO2 max? The most important health metric you’re probably not aware of shows how fit you really are
item.description: VO2 max is one of the best indicators of your cardiovascular fitness—do you know yours?

item.title: A golf course manager says his business could lose $500,000 a year if daylight saving time goes away
item.description: Golf has deep roots in the history of daylight saving time, which begins for most states at 2 a.m. Sunday when clocks “spring forward” by one hour.

item.title: Trump’s Affinity for Putin Grows More Consequential Than Ever
item.description: President Trump’s admiration for President Vladimir Putin of Russia has been endlessly dissected, but the American leader’s policy shifts since taking...

item.title: How Mayor Eric Adams Lost New York City
item.description: He promised law and order. Instead, his scandal-ridden mayoralty became a symbol — and engine — of the city’s chaos.

item.title: Japan’s Ski Slopes Have Too Much of a Good Thing: Snow
item.description: While the country is having a banner ski season, exceptionally heavy snowfall has created challenges for resort workers.

item.title: ‘America First’ policies are threatening American exceptionalism as the economy and markets flash warning signs
item.description: "We are still betting on the resilience of consumers and the economy. However, Trump Turmoil 2.0 is significantly testing the resilience of both."

item.title: Lebron James and Silicon Valley’s elite use hyperbaric oxygen therapy to stall aging and inflammation. Here’s what it’s all about
item.description: The treatment is increasingly popping up among longevity chasing biohackers and at spas and wellness centers.

item.title: Russian Strikes Kill 20 in Eastern Ukraine
item.description: The bombardment came after Washington’s decision to suspend intelligence sharing and hit a region critical for Ukrainian logistics and support.

item.title: Russian Strikes Kill 20 in Eastern Ukraine
item.description: The bombardment came after Washington’s decision to suspend intelligence sharing and hit a region critical for Ukrainian logistics and support.

item.title: South Korea’s President, Yoon Suk Yeol, Released From Detention
item.description: The move followed a court ruling that the detention of President Yoon Suk Yeol was invalid, but it won’t affect the insurrection and other charges he ...

item.title: Gene Hackman Lost His Wife and Caregiver, and Spent 7 Days Alone
item.description: The exact details may never be known, but Mr. Hackman, 95 with advanced Alzheimer’s, was alone for about a week after his wife and sole caregiver died...
